title: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Elements, Buhl", September 21, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from top left: (to right of drawing) window glass / leaded. flat; (beginning at top of drawing at right) rather large and heavy (pointing to finial) / 2 fl overhang of shed - / 18 in overhang / these beams / very pretty idea / (to left of this drawing) Sometimes this beam / is described as a cornice / also lower one; (beginning above drawing at lower right) tile / birch with plaster / stone / about 24 ft across front / very pretty little stable. (to left of this drawing) slats square...; (at bottom right edge of sheet) Buhl Sept 21st 1887 / Black Forest; (to right of bottom left drawing) side of stable / should have grape vines growing on it / light green leaf / side; (at top of two drawings above) watershed / window and pannelling [sic] / under window.
description: Vertical sheet with sketches of timber structures and architectural details.  At top left is a round-arched leaded glass window composed of round glass lenses and promient metal bars dividing the window vertically and horizontally.  At right is the façade of a timber and plaster building with its upper stories fully rendered.  The building has a tiled roof, deep eaves, and a projecting canopy.  At center left are two sketches: the shuttered window of a water shed, and the detail of cross-beam paneling below.  Below these is another quickly sketched half-timbered building (possibly the same as that shown above right).  At bottom right is a stable seen from the side.  Its has a pair of double doors with an open timbered slats above.  Its right side is timber and plaster with a stone course below.  It has a single door opening with a small square window to its proper right.  Above this is another square window with prominent strap hinges also at proper right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Elements, Buhl", September 21, 1887.
September 21, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-130.
